Thinking with Type

I just finished reading Thinking with Type by Ellen Lupton. There are a lot of great concepts in this book, so I decided to create a few designs using typography to show off my favorites.

Think more, design less.

Some type crimes to be aware of:

  • Horizontal and vertical scaling
  • Vertically stacking lowercase
  • Using too many signals (bold, italic, underlined, caps)
  • Don't trap data in heavily guarded cells
